intro: Gymnocalycium schmidianum, commonly known as the Schmidianus moon cactus, is a species of cactus native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and thick, fleshy stems that store water, allowing it to survive in arid environments. The plant produces yellow or orange flowers during the growing season, which are typically short-lived but striking in appearance. Its leaves are modified into spines, and it has a shallow root system adapted to rocky soils. Gymnocalycium schmidianum is popular as a houseplant due to its low maintenance and unique appearance.
